nodes.bodyText: I installed Android SDK 27 manually, I don't have a java11 file or folder?

java11 folder is added in downloadAdditionalAndroidLibs().
Those dependencies are needed since sdkmanager has a long standing issue about running on java > 8.
What Java version is required? Probably better to use full path (i.e $JAVA_HOME/bin/java), verifying that JAVA_HOME is set, or even publicConfig.getGraalPath() if that works as well?
Probably add exceptions to method signature instead?
Probably warn the user with a logged message that he/she will be prompted
don't use static, once set it will be used by all the processes (there is a pending PR to remove the static for the other booleans too)

Don't we want to fail as fast as possible? When an IOException occurs, it probably means that something failed during the automatic download of the android tools (SDK, NDK or additional libraries). The user will most likely get the following error message instead:

You specified an android ndk, but it doesn't contain /toolchains/llvm/prebuilt/linux-x86_64/bin/ldlld

This is both cryptic and and a bit misleading, because the error might be for instance that the download of the Android SDK failed because of http proxy issues. Or any other actual IO exception that caused the download, unpacking or installing any of the android tools to fail.
Maybe it can be removed. If not, use Logger.logDebug with a more descriptive message
Missed this before: Can you move this to a constant on top of the file? We shouldn't have these hardcoded versions hidden in a method.
